subject: Photography
title: Non-Destructive Editing Philosophy
description: A quick win: understand Non-Destructive Editing Philosophy.

hook.text: Delete a layer by mistake? Undo. Change your mind a year later? No problem. Non-destructive editing forgives.

buildup.text: Non-destructive editing means changes are stored as instructions, not permanently applied to the original file.

discovery.text: This approach lets you revisit any edit at any time. The original data remains untouched and fully recoverable.

twist.text: Film editing was always destructive â€” cut the negative and it was gone forever. Digital freed us from that risk.

climax.text: Non-destructive workflow is now standard in professional photography. It separates amateurs from pros.

punchline.text: Never destroy the original. You might want it back.

quiz.question: What does non-destructive editing preserve?
options: The original file data, storing changes as reversible instructions
Only the latest version of the edit
A backup of the camera settings
